items.title: QatarEnergy’s North Field West LNG Project Startup Slips to 2031
items.summary: QatarEnergy has lined up construction partners for one of its massive LNG export expansion projects as it pushes toward 142 million tons/year (Mt/y) in export capacity by next decade.

items.title: Warmth Spreads Across Europe, Asia as U.S. LNG Exports Poised to Rebound
items.summary: Geopolitical influence on U.S. LNG demand is muscling out weather signals as patterns trend considerably mild in Europe and Asia into early March, according to forecasters.

items.title: Permian, Northeast Forward Natural Gas Prices Fall Sharply With Spring Around the Corner
items.summary: Bearish forecasts and the upcoming shoulder season weighed on forward natural gas prices through next winter over the past week.

items.title: Amigo LNG MOU Targets Permian Natural Gas Glut, Negative Waha Prices
items.summary: Mexico’s national pipeline operator, Cenagas, has signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with an affiliate of Amigo LNG to develop a 48-inch natural gas pipeline.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Inching Higher on Stout LNG, Hints of Scattered Cold
items.summary: April natural gas futures rose modestly through midday Friday, as mostly mild forecasts teased a potential mid-March cool shot.

items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Old Man Winter Postpones Vacation and Natural Gas Cash Cruises
items.summary: Physical gas prices advanced on Friday for Sunday through Monday delivery as buyers in the Midwest and East shifted their focus from healthy supply to an expected shot of cold to start the week ahead.

items.title: Futures Settle: Natural Gas Prices Nudge Higher Amid Competing Fundamentals
items.summary: April natural gas futures traded cautiously on Friday as market participants tried to balance hardy export activity and bargain buying against weakening weather demand and stout supply.

items.title: Aramco Starts Natural Gas Production at Middle East’s Largest Shale Play
items.summary: Venture Global Inc. has signed its first long-term deal with a South Korean offtaker, agreeing to supply LNG to Hanwha Aerospace Co. Ltd.

items.title: Natural Gas Exports to Dawn Rising Even as Prices Slump Below $3 After February Blizzard
items.summary: After a historic run to around $62.000/MMBtu in late January amid Winter Storm Fern, NGI’s Dawn daily price is closing February below $3.000.

items.title: How America’s Action in Venezuela Guaranteed Guyana’s Oil Future
items.summary: Once one of South America’s poorest countries, Guyana is now ranked among the world’s richest because of the vast petroleum wealth contained in its territorial waters. A swath of major oil discoveries in the offshore Stabroek Block by operator ExxonM

items.title: U.S. Crude Daily Average Production Falls in December as Bakken Leads Pullback
items.summary: Average daily crude oil production in the United States eased in December to the lowest daily production rate in months, according to the latest EIA data. Total December production, however, was higher than in November. According to the EIA, U.S. cru

items.title: The Oil Glut That Never Showed Up
items.summary: Every cycle produces its own comforting myth, for 2026, that is the “inevitable oil glut.” The reasoning behind that is mainly that crude oil producers are pumping more, Iran is still exporting despite sanctions pressure, and the market expects OPEC+

items.title: US Oil Drilling Activity Slows as Oil Prices Jump
items.summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States fell this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday, bringing the total rig count in the US to 550 this week, down 43 from this same time last year.

items.title: Gulf Oil Producers Open the Taps as Iran Risk Premium Builds
items.summary: As U.S.-Iran tensions climb and talk of a potential strike refuses to fade, the UAE and Saudi Arabia are already behaving as if an oil supply disruption is a matter of when, not if. If they move more crude now, there is a chance there will be calm ma

items.title: Russia Shipped 80% of its 2025 Oil Exports to China and India
items.summary: Russia’s oil exports were essentially flat in 2025 compared to a year earlier, with most supplies – a massive 80% -- going to China and India, Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak said on Friday.  Last year, Russian oil exports were about 23
